description: A collection of circles in a cylindrical formation which tapers towards the top; there is also a ring of circles above the cylindrical formation and a triangular formation of circles extending outwards from the right side of the cylindrical formation. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is an orange triangle in the center of the cylindrical formation and a pale purple triangle at the top of the triangular formation.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
